intro: Diplycosia lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
